main event: A civilian observed a silver flash followed by a light green ball descending vertically, which left a light brown trail before striking the ground near Hinkle, Oregon.
interesting points: The sighting time was reported as 1630 PST on 23 April 1952.,The witness is a railroad engineer from Walla Walla, Washington.,The object left a visible trail for about 20-30 seconds after impact.,The report mentions that other unidentified witnesses claimed to have seen the brownish trail after the object struck the ground.,There was a possibility that the object could have been a meteoric body.
sighted object: light green ball with a silver flash
